CAPTION FIG1.png: 'Figure 1: Examples of (a) clumpy and diffuse resource distributions and (b) paths of 2 participants in the clumpy and diffuse treatments. In the example distributions, black pixels represent resources (not seen by participants until they passed over them). The clock in the upper right corner counted down during the task, showing the number of remaining search steps possible, given the time limit; search steps were measured in pixels (20 pixels per second). In the example paths, gray circles are positioned over the pixels where participants found a resource.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG2.png: 'Figure 2: Results from the spatial-foraging task: mean turning angle when participants encountered resources in the dummy versus diffuse environments. Error bars show standard errors of the norm.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: Mean difference in time spent within letter sets between the pattest and the pretest (in seconds), for the clumpy versus diffuse environments. Error bars show standard errors of the means.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG4.png:
'

**Fig. 4.** Latencies to switch (in seconds) to the next letter set following the last word submitted, for the clumpy versus diffuse environments. Error bars show standard errors of the means.
